My phone might not have the best RAM but when I switch apps but Notally doesn't autosave anything and I lose literally everything I wrote in the last 15 minutes or more. It's so frustrating I lost some important notes because I had to check something on another app.

User friendly, nice, clean, light, feature rich, and versatile. Great!
perfect.
Had to switch to this app from Google Keep. OpenSource and has some options for different text styles.

Notally has the perfect mix of simplicity, utility, and beauty. Taking notes is as easy as pressing a button. The app implements Material Design, a clean & practical design language. Notes can be labeled, archived, or deleted. Notally not only lets users export/import backups, but also automatically back up notes to a preferred folder. And the app is generously customizable. Whether you wish to write a long love note, a quick grocery checklist, or your best friend's birthday, Notally is for you!
Lightweight, private and easy to use. Truly a hidden gem in the note-taking application category.
Perfection. The app needs nothing more than to stay as it is. It works flawlessly.

Quick list of needed improvements: Use two FABs for New Note and Add List aligned horizontally at the bottom right. Implement MD3. Implement transparent Android Navigation Bar and Status bar and draw content below it. Support Dynamic colors.
A very good app for note taking easy to use app
Exceptional notes easy-to-use no data collection no ads thank you so much

It would be a simple great app, but I could not find a way to set the storage folder, I think it uses an internal DB to save the notes, instead of simple txt files in the file system. There is an export functionality but it has to be run manually each time

google_play_reviews.replyContent: Hi Yuri, to delete an item in a list, just swipe towards left or right.

Really nice and convenient for all sorts of purposes. Only suggestions I have are: The ability to use bullet point lists inside notes, and the adding the formatting options (bold, italicize, underscore) as actual buttons at the top of the UI. Other than that, this thing is great üëç.

google_play_reviews.replyContent: Hi Thato, if you'll compare the publication dates of both the apps, you'll see that Notally was published a year before Notex and is the original app.

google_play_reviews.content: Minimalist design but core features of a notes app are there and free. Can be organized by labels. Able to be exported as PDF file (rarely offered by most notes app, while others make it a paid feature). Plus, ad-free. Almost perfect for my intended use. My only problem is I cannot find the text formatting feature. Is it not supported by older versions of Android? Hopefully, you'll consider: undo button, folders, modify text size, & password for certain notes or an app lock. Thank you!

google_play_reviews.replyContent:
Hello Basim,
To access the formatting options, please long press on the text you want to format. A floating toolbar will open up containing different options to do the same.
